intro: Sphaeranthus randii var. randii, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a spherical cluster, giving it its common name. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. The species is adapted to thrive in sandy or gravelly soils with minimal rainfall.
